body:
Comment 2 by **nicolas.b.pierron**: 
No, NixOS does not have /usr/bin/env, because this is consider as an impurity in the 
sense that you may get any program which has the same name but not the expected 
behavior.  NixPkgs tries to explicit most of the dependencies.

The idea behind these is that accessing to a program is similar to dereferencing a 
pointer.  Thus having incomplete dependencies is similar to guessing which memory area 
looks like your data. (No such file or directory === Segmentation fault)
